eOcambo Residence
9.5 Exceptional
Based on 44 reviews

eOcambo is an amazing boutique hotel in Siem Reap. Excellent value for your money. Upon arrival you feel that you are visiting your best friend and your room is ready for you.

The service is high standards. We highly recommend this beautiful hotel. The rooms are decorated with the natural and elegant luxury. Beautiful surprise! The staff is extremely professional. This property is hidden but central located, and very easy to access to everywhere in central of siem reap.

Show more
Mason , Australia
Royal Crown Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 767 reviews

Our stay was great. Service is exceptional, rooms are spacious and comfy, the buffet breakfast is great, pools are really good and of course the location is ideal being close to the old market and entertainment areas.

There are restaurants very close to the hotel. I had only one gripe but I should emphasise that it is minor and probably difficult to control due to piping. The men's toilets adjacent to the dining room were clogged on 1 occasion around breakfast time. I raised the issue with hotel staff and it was quickly resolved.

Show more
Ian , Ireland
Golden Temple Residence
9.6 Exceptional
Based on 394 reviews

Wonderful boutique hotel in the heart of Siem Reap but on a quiet side street. From the moment you arrive and are presented with complimentary drinks and spring rolls to the check out when the front desk staff member accompanies you and the driver to the airport, you feel pampered.

The hotel provides you with a cell phone for local calls upon check in. The complimentary dinner was beautifully presented and may be the best meal we had in Siem Reap. The complimentary massages were excellent . There is also nightly happy hour with open bar and appetizers and a nightly local dance performance. The rooms were large,modern and clean with nightly turn down service. The bed was a bit firm for my taste but this was typical throughout our stay in Vietnam and Cambodia. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Show more
Randall , United States
Okay Boutique Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 1022 reviews

Really amazing place to stay. Room and facilities were incredible. Great breakfast with a lot of choice - pancakes, bacon, eggs cooked whichever way you like as well as traditional food.

We did a half day tour with the hotel which was $16. Private tuk tuk took us to cheong ek (killing fields) and tuoul sloen (s21) museum. Well worth the money. Our driver took us to an amazing restaurant for lunch as well. Staff were helpful but English not the best. We booked a bus through them to Sihanoukville and then a boat to Koh Rong. The hotel said the bus would take 4 hours but it took 6 so we missed our boat which was very annoying. The bus company were good and found us another boat to the island but it was a very frustrating afternoon! We went to an amazing Mexican near to the hotel called cocina cartel - amazing burritos! Only 5 mins round the corner, would highly recommend along with this hotel

Show more
Emily , United Kingdom
Metta Residence & Spa
9.4 Exceptional
Based on 173 reviews

We stayed at Metta for 7 nights. The room is really big and very clean. I especially like the room has no drawers or cupboard, all the storage is open so you see everything easily and won't leave anything behind.

The best asset of this hotel is their staff. They are always smiling. They have fulfilled all my requests and when I asked for something, it always came right away. The hotel provides free tuk tuk service from 5-10pm. They also have free airport pickup and drop off in a nice air-condition SUV/8 seater. The breakfast was ok and they have free cocktail from 6-7pm. I really like the pool area. The welcome drink they served us was really yummy, I had to ask for second!! The free 4 course dinner they offered us was very delicious too. The hotel was also able to arrange my Angkor Wat tour just 1 day notice without any hassle. The hotel might be a bit far from town but it only cost $2-3 to get into town by tuk tuk and all the hotel tuk tuk drivers are so funny and friendly . Didn't get a chance to try the spa but it looked really nice. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends because I know the staff always take good care of their guests.

Show more
Tina , Canada
Royal Crown Hotel & Spa
8.4 Excellent
Based on 2687 reviews

We had a very pleasant stay at the Royal Crown. We chose this hotel because it is in walking distance to the busy city center's markets and restaurants, while hotel itself is situated on the more quiet side of the river.

We booked the cheapest room, which was nice, big and comfortable, and equipped with everything you would expect from a hotel of this standard. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet was an absolute highlight with so many Western and Asian specialties to choose from – a reason to get somewhat earlier than usual in order to have more time to taste all delicacies. We will be back.

Show more
Marco , Switzerland
Hotel Somadevi Angkor Resort & Spa
8.5 Excellent
Based on 2107 reviews

Not a 4 star hotel. The reception should improve the customer service. It would be good they check room items before checking in to avoid accuse customers of missing items in check out time.

One of the ways to the airport is free. On the way back to the airport we were asked if we used the service when we arrived, which we replied we hired a taxi. They understood this as a yes and proceed to charge use 11usd for the way back, even they check with our room number we didn't use the service. Later we make them notice that, and the man with very bad attitude said he asked us very clear question before. They gave us back the 11usd, but attitude was terrible. Most of other staff were very nice and kind.

Show more
Jordi , Spain
The Privilege Floor by BOREI ANGKOR
9.1 Exceptional
Based on 432 reviews

I don't often write reviews about hotels but I had such a great time at the Privilege Floor at Borei Angkor that I want to let the world know.

Ms. Judy, our assistant and Mr. Sakhorn, our guide were always amazingly a step ahead of us with an almost telepathic ability to predict what we needed or where we wanted to go making our trip as pleasant as possible. On our forays out into the temples, Mr. Sakhorn was able to introduce us to the specifics of each temple as well as talk to us about the countryside in the area (where he grew up) which I felt really helped us get a handle on the area. Also every time we got back from a temple he has these chilled moist towels (which were also infused with lemongrass oil, of course) to help cool us down. Siem Reap is pretty brutally hot in August and taking a cold water/cold towel break in between temples made a world of difference. I can't speak enough about how wonderful the service was. I'm fairy well travelled and have never experienced anything like it. The hotel itself is wonderful. The dark wood finishing and ever present hint of lemongrass in the air has quite the effect. Our rooms were comfortable and they even brought us bowls of fruit! We also enjoyed the cocktail hour where their solid bartenders make a mean Tom Collins What's crazy is that in the end, this place, and experience (I don't use that term lightly) was rediculously affordable. I often caught myself thinking I should do this type of thing more, before realizing that in most places I can't afford to. But here you can afford to treat yourself, and given how great the Borei Angkor is, you absolutely should.

Show more
Michael , United States
SUN & MOON Urban Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 524 reviews

Booked into the hotel initially in a standard room which was very funky and immaculately clean. Then switched to a King suite and asked for something special to await us in the room (they made the little heart swans out of towels and rose petals saying I love you) as it was our third anniversary.

The suite was pretty swish and facilities at the hotel were excellent. Staff were helpful and friendly and the breakfast was plentiful and of a standard. Pool area is a real selling point and there is always stuff happening on the 9 the floor. A convenience store is located across the street that sells wine/via and everything in between. My only gripe would be the jacuzzis are separated by sex so we couldn't bath together.

Show more
Stuart , United Kingdom
Phnom Penh Katari Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 348 reviews

The location is excellent Just off the busy maim road but close to a variety of coffee shops bakeries and restaurants.

Easy walk to the Palace ,240 street and independence monument. The staff are friendly,helpful and polite with good spoken English. The pool is a delight and very relaxing. Breakfast included in stay is good though yoghurt might be a nice addition The room was great comfortable mattress and pillows great shower and towels. Trying to think of a negative isn't easy..... A bright light for makeup/shaving ? But really! We enjoyed our stay and would definitely book again Upgrade to a Junior Suite was an unexpected bonus as was early check in Thanks Katari.

Show more
kathleen , Australia
Central Suite Residence
9.4 Exceptional
Based on 351 reviews

We arrived in a somewhat chaotic lot, with some construction (of another guesthouse) going on. But as we enter, it was an oasis of calm.

Greeted with courteous and accommodating staff despite the wee hours of our arrival. Always ready with cold towels after a hot day of touring, the service is top-notch. Our room was spacious with a seating area and a balcony. The only complain (but really not a big deal) is that our bed was designed at an angle that makes it impossible to get out on one side of the bed. The bathroom is the best part of the room. Spacious and well designed complete with a rain shower (my kind of shower). Breakfast was good – excellent baguette, and I love their yogurt. But my favorite of the buffet style breakfast spread was the traditional noodle soup. The Spa – I went twice during our 4-night stay. Need I say more? One of the best massage I’ve had in my many, many spa experiences. A must when staying here. Located near Pub Street where restaurants abound. They are just a few steps away Genevieve’s, a highly recommended restaurant. Next door to Genevieve’s is Kuriousity Café, another must-visit café serving very good BBQ ribs.

Show more
jennifer , Philippines
Sokha Phnom Penh Hotel
8.2 Excellent
Based on 299 reviews

On the whole we had a great stay. Highlights were the fantastically modern, clean and comfortable rooms (though it was hard to regulate the shower temperature), the pool (though service was often slow / non-existent), the rooftop drinking / dining options, and the excellent buffet breakfast (with proper coffee!).

Would definitely stay again for the $105 net we paid on Agoda. If it were to rise substantially more than this, we may opt for a more centrally located boutique option (BKK1 or Riverside) for a similar price. Poolside drinks and snacks are way overpriced ($11++ for a club sandwich) and really should not be in the price range of the Sofitel/Intercon/Raffles. A reduction here would certainly make them more competitive alongside the big three. Room for improvement but generally very good.

Show more
NEIL , United Kingdom
Golden Temple Hotel
9.3 Exceptional
Based on 1397 reviews

The staff at the Golden Temple Hotel were fantastic: friendly and helpful, from the moment we stepped off the plane and were greeted at the airport, to the moment we were dropped back for our departure.

The hotel is ideally situated in town, just across the river from the noisy and bustling Pub Street, but close enough to walk within 5 minutes (or 2 minutes on a tuk-tuk) to enjoy the markets and nightlife. The hotel is close to the newer Kings Road - which houses great modern restaurants and a less chaotic market, selling goods made in Cambodia. The hotel were able to arrange a great tour of Angkor Wat at a good price, with pick up and drop off at the hotel. Great options for the tour and other activities. We greatly enjoyed a complimentary massage experience. The only shame is that we had booked a return flight, so couldn't stay longer!

Show more
Tom , United Kingdom
King Rock Boutique Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 343 reviews

We were travelled with family of 7 adults stayed in this hotel for 4 nights on 19th May16. We were greeted by lovely lady, Tiffany upon check-in.

Welcomed drink and cold towers were served. Tiffany patiently explained the surrounding and recommended places for food. Our package included one way airport transfer on the day we arrived. However, we had arranged another day tour agent to pick us up. She is kind to adjust the complimentary one way transfer as our last day back to airport. The hotel location is good, 5 mins walks to Night market and 10 mins to Old Market. The bed is soft and comfortable. AC and bathroom shower is strong. Room's wifi is steady. The only cons would be the door for my room is pretty hard to lock, which the hotel had promised to adjust the lock after we left. If you are looking at valued stay and walking distance to market and pub street, this hotel is one of the good choice.

Show more
Melissa , Malaysia
Prince d'Angkor Hotel & Spa
8.5 Excellent
Based on 1870 reviews

Our stay overall was pleasant, especially the breakfast, the cleanliness of the rooms and most of the front of house staff.

However, the questionable blue toilet would not flush, the ceiling in one of the rooms leaked with the heavy rain and there was additionally a very strong smell of paint fumes throughout the night. Unfortunately, the only truly unpleasant incidence was a dispute about false room charges which were completely inaccurate. Moreover the staff member in question was accusing and unnecessarily rude. However, despite these few issues, the junior staff were welcoming and helpful, the lobby musicians were incredible and the location could not be understated - it was only a 7 minute walk to the markets and pub street!

Show more
Thusith , United Kingdom
Harmony Phnom Penh Hotel
8.3 Excellent
Based on 978 reviews

We stayed here a few weeks before, but came back, despite problems of entrance (stairs, smell) and staff (front desk).

Once checked in, this is a good hotel, with nice rooms, fantastic pool with its stunning view) and a handy location. Entrance problems remain. Staff difficult to deal with on front desk ... they take ages to decide anything, would not accept our US$100 bills as a deposit on check in, yet wanted to give us one on checkout. Did not follow our request for high floor with south facing view, and they failed on our request for a wake up call. No call to our room at all and no apology on checkout. So make up your mind ....nice hotel, if you can put up with these annoyances.

Show more
Blair , New Zealand
Memoire d' Angkor Boutique Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 1329 reviews

Hi, The hotel was clean and the staff was polite but its is not a 4 star hotel it claims it is. Here is my reasoning for the the statement I made: 1) The staff although polite - struggles to speak fluent English 2) The quality of stuff in the room is below average - example quality of tissue paper, the assortment of coffee/tea provided in room etc.

3) Water was leaking from the cabinet below the sink. The tiles below the sink were always wet 4) There was a wall lizard in my room. It kept on making those weird noises at night. My wife is scared of lizards and it totally spoiled her experience. Although I highlighted the issue to staff next morning things did not change. 5) The prices on their menu are 3 times the average prices in restaurants outside. So much - despite having not up to mark services. Although we had to pay only 70 SG dollars per night - we were under the impression that it is a 4 star hotel. We would have willingly paid more for some other genuine 4 star hotel instead. ~XXX

Show more
Ravindra , India
Golden Temple Retreat
9.6 Exceptional
Based on 241 reviews

From the moment I entered the hotel i knew i had made the right choice. I was welcomed with a welcome drink cold towel and something to eat.

Was made to sit on the couch during my check in and a brief roundup of everything included was given. The staff at the hotel was just amazing. They make you feel very much at home from the moment you are there till you check out of the hotel. Always asking you if you needed anything with a smile , asking about your day and plans and if you need help with anything at all. the rooms are huge , very clean and well decorated. The bathrooms also are huge and fantastic giving off a spa feeling. the breakfast had a big spread of choices and changes everyday. the 4 course dinner was very good as well and the presentation was simply fantastic. The Khmer massage at the spa was really good. The pool though a little narrow was still very nice and good place to hang at. during the day they serve you complimentary drink and snacks by the pool which is a nice gesture. Everything is close by you can walk tot eh market or pub street or take a 2 mins tuk tuk. I could go on about the place and the wonderful service but you have to experience it to believe it. the entire staff was wonderful, especially Hong Sopheak who was my go to person for everything i needed. the pictures on their website is what the place actually looks like. Would not stay anywhere else but here when i visit Siam Reap again !!

Show more
ajay , India
Aquarius Hotel & Urban Resort - Phnom Penh
8.8 Excellent
Based on 423 reviews

We were very impressed from the moment we reached the hotel till we checked out! The staffs were very friendly and helpful! The rooms were very nice and clean with well functioning facilities.

They also have a very very pretty pool at the roof with awesome view! We feel the hotel is also located in a very good area! Its near the main attractions like royal palace etc. Found out from the staff that the hotel is only 3-4 months old. This probably explains why the hotel is very new and clean with modern design. Hope the hotel will be able to maintain this standard in the long run! Only downside was that the airport transfer to the hotel cost us 12USD. We realised that we could have taken alternative transportation such as the tuktuk for a lower price. We would definitely choose to stay here if we travel to Phnom Penh again! :)

Show more
Boon , Singapore
Sokha Express By Sokha Beach Resort
7.8 Very good
Based on 35 reviews

Mary Beach Hotel and Resort
8 Very good
Based on 236 reviews

This hotel and it's staff made our visit to Cambodia memorable and complete. The best service that we experienced in Cambodia.

The first impression was remarkable. ..the manager ( owner ?) Daniel was on top of his game from the moment we stepped in to the hotel...beautiful hotel with a beautiful and clean beach to add to this memorable experience. By far the best beach setting in Sihanoukville, peace and quiet with island hoping, snorkeling and other beach activities. Great restaurant with a nicely priced menu. Tasty food served by a staff that made you feel at home. This is a place where you go to relax and enjoy a peaceful gorgeous beach. This is the total package, nice and clean hotel accommodations, pool and sauna, beach front restaurant and a beautiful clean beach. Why would anyone stay any other place in Sihanoukville? Daniel keep it up, you and your staff are winners...I can't wait to come back to your place...Wow! It was fabulous. I highly recommend this hotel to all travelers. You can't beat the price and the experience.

Show more
Milinda , United States
Raffles Hotel Le Royal
8.8 Excellent
Based on 582 reviews

We live in Phnom Penh for years, and it becomes a tradition to stay at Raffles hotel for my wife birthday (but not only), which i mentioned for the first time in the reservation.

The hotel offered us few things, including a birthday cake. They even sent me an email to ask which flavor we like! The hotel is quiet and relaxing, rooms are well designed and comfortable, service is perfect. Even guests says hello to each others in the corridors. The food is great in all restaurants, don't miss the outstanding breakfast! Staff at the swimming pool offered some ice creams to all swimmers in the afternoon. Staff at Monivong cafe took care of our kids. The Spa uses high quality products from France, Dermalogica. Luxury is about details. In Raffles, you have them all! I read some negative comments regarding the wifi speed, probably from guests arriving from Europe. I would like to say this is much faster than any other hotel in Cambodia! This is the first review I write on Agoda. Congratulations to all the staff!

Show more
Bruno , France
Lumiere Hotel
8.8 Excellent
Based on 71 reviews

New and nice hotel. Location is relatively centralise but still need to do abit of walking. Room is spacious and clean, however the corridor is too dim and there is no cutlery in the room to cut fruits.

Also, the replenishment for the mini bar is not complete, one of the days during my stay, there was no Sprite at all ,only when I feedback to front desk then they deliver the Sprite to me. The Jacker potato chips (hot & spicy) really taste good, was out of stocks, no replenishment & did not have replacement of other flavour of potato chips! Lastly, the Tuk Tuk drivers by the hotel are really bad, all the way out to reap $$$ from tourist like us though the fare was already confirmed by the hotel but upon reaching the destination, the tuk tuk drivers insisted we pay US$0.50 more. This will definitely tarnish the image of the hotel which give us a bad experience if not the stay at Lumiere will be perfect.

Show more
SOI , Singapore
Sofitel Phnom Penh Phokeethra Hotel
8.6 Excellent
Based on 296 reviews

this is a relatively new hotel compared to others in the area. therefore, some taxi drivers or those "tuk-tuk" operators (similar to those in bangkok) will have problems locating it.

do remember to get a name card of the hotel so that you can pass to the drivers/operators. if needs be, get assistance from nearby folks to translate for you. almost all buildings along the main streets will have friendly security guards who are more than willing to help (those that speak english). once you are inside the hotel, you feel that you have entered another world. the quietness is excellent for a good rest and relax. the location is near to few interesting places, including those related to shopping. (see travel tip).

Show more
FOO , Singapore
J7 Hotel
9.2 Exceptional
Based on 73 reviews

Brent , United States
Sokhalay Angkor Villa Resort
8.2 Excellent
Based on 394 reviews

Sokhalay Angkor Villa Resort is a rare instance when the real place actually exceeds the expectations set by images on the resort's website.

The buildings are impressively constructed wooden villas in Khmer style; the grounds are lush and provide deep shade from the Cambodian sun; the pool is crystal clear. The rooms are large with wood floors, handsome furniture, and modern fixtures. Our poolside double villa had a king size bed and a nap-able sofa with lots of room left over for baby to play. At another stage of life, the resort's distance from town might have been a bigger disadvantage, but with baby in tow, we would have had limited opportunities for night life and markets. Our half day expeditions into the temple areas (between naps) were affordably managed with cars provided by the hotel. And our time at the hotel was extremely pleasant - the capable young staff went far beyond the necessary to make our stay with the infant as pleasant as possible. The main restaurant is a beautifully built Khmer style wooden pavilion, open air and surrounded by a carp and lotus-filled moat. The breakfast was plentiful, though options for those unaccustomed to Asian breakfast items such as noodles and rice porridge might find the choices limited. Dinner at the hotel was very good, especially the western options. The menu would benefit from more Khmer selections, but all the meals were flavourful and well presented. The service was always gracious, friendly, and attentive. The place is not without its faults. Ants found any scrap of food left out overnight. There were a few pea-sized jumping spiders on the curtains as well. But if these minor issues don't turn you away, and you don't mind being a 12 min tuk-tuk ride away from the bustle and hustle of the Old Market, we'd strongly recommend giving Sokhalay Angkor Villas a look.

Talked to the staff a couple of times about this and not much effort was put in to getting the correct password ... they suggested logging into another hotspot, but the signals from the other ones were marginal in our room and continually dropped in an out. I had to go to another restaurant/resort to get some work done before the New Year. Also the safe in the room was broken and the staff said that it couldn't be fixed and the one in the other room which my in-laws were staying - sad. The rooms and facility were nice though. I would suggest staying at the Sahaa resort next door which I've stayed before!

Shane , United States
Belmond La Residence d'Angkor
9 Excellent
Based on 113 reviews

For the price they charge, this hotel is not a 5 star luxury hotel. when we check in, the front desk person kept saying what a fantastic room we had been given.

We had booked a deluxe pool side room and we were taken to 3rd floor, pretty far off in the other end of the hotel. We saw smoke coming out from the pool area and asked what that was. They said they were having a emergency renovation. They were digging and drilling at the pool. We decided to go out and spend some time outside of the hotel, hoping when back, the emergency renovation was done and over with. When we got back they were still drilling. We asked for a new room and also asked when they would be done with the renovation. We got the answer that it would take several days from 8 AM to 5 PM. That was when we called Agoda and tried to cancel our booking at the Belmond. The Agoda representative told me that he had to call the hotel and ask them about this. When he called me back, he told me that the hotel management had said that the renovation was not at the hotel and it was the sound from outside hotel. This angered us since they were lying. So we took pictures of the renovation of the pool and we just checked out. Fortunately Agoda wrote to us and offered us a cancellation of the remaining 2 nights. We went not far from Belmond. Surprisingly is cheaper than Belmond but much much better. I can not understand why people should stay anywhere else.

The One Resort
8.6 Excellent

Was so sad to leave. We had a perfect stay. I will be telling friends and family to absolutely go to Koh Rong Samleom and stay here if ever in Cambodia.

The travel time (coming from Siem Reap) was well worth it. Best decision ever! Walked up and down the beach and can definitely say this resort is SO much better than any other resort on this side of the island. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. The One also has the best beach, there is no need to leave the resort. Absolutely stunning, felt like a paradise! Wish we had the option to book a beach front bungalow. The food options could be improved but we found a few good dishes. There was a resort a few places over called Lime Beach Lounge that had good food. I'm sure you could find others. Motherhome Inn
8.7 Excellent
Based on 380 reviews

The staff was extremely friendly and helpful throughout the stay. When I arrived they helped to arrange additional room and pick-up for my friends who decided to join me at the last minute.

They assisted in arranging a very affordable car and driver for our siteseeing at the last minute. When we departed before 4:30 a.m. to see the sunrise at Angkor Wat we were very pleasantly surprised to see the hotel had made "to-go" breakfasts for us since we were leaving before the buffet opened. The quiet nature of the hotel was wonderful for sleeping. Given that we were up at 4:00 a.m. every day to sitesee it was very comforting to know we could get a good night's rest before. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other traveling to Siem Reap.

Bou Savy Guesthouse
8.3 Excellent
Based on 571 reviews

I stayed here with my girlfriend for four days while visiting the Angkor temples. We both agree that our stay was fantastic.

During this time there was a "promotion" where we would get free tuk tuk pickup from Siem Reap International back to the hotel. As promised, tuk tuk was ready for us when we arrived. If you are looking for a hotel, this is not it. It is a guesthouse. Simple, but comfortable, rooms. Amenities are basic. It fit with what we wanted and needed, since we were always busy seeing the temples while were were staying there. I recommend bringing your own toiletries, since none are provided (or just buy them at the gas station quick mart across the street). Free breakfast was a nice perk to have before setting out for the day. Overall, a good place to stay that is quiet and close to downtown (walking or tuk-tuk ride).

We are beyond pleased. Super, mega, highly-recommended for those who are looking for great service, good location at super affordable prices.

More about Cambodia

If you are looking for a holiday destination in Asia, then Cambodia is the place to go, offering something for everyone. Why pay more if you don't have to? On our forays out into the temples, Mr. Sakhorn was able to introduce us to the specifics of each temple as well as talk to us about the countryside in the area (where he grew up) which I felt really helped us get a handle on the area. Also every time we got back from a temple he has these chilled moist towels (which were also infused with lemongrass oil, of course) to help cool us down. Siem Reap is pretty brutally hot in August and taking a cold water/cold towel break in between temples made a world of difference. I can't speak enough about how wonderful the service was. I'm fairy well travelled and have never experienced anything like it. The hotel itself is wonderful. The dark wood finishing and ever present hint of lemongrass in the air has quite the effect. Our rooms were comfortable and they even brought us bowls of fruit! We also enjoyed the cocktail hour where their solid bartenders make a mean Tom Collins What's crazy is that in the end, this place, and experience (I don't use that term lightly) was rediculously affordable. I often caught myself thinking I should do this type of thing more, before realizing that in most places I can't afford to. But here you can afford to treat yourself, and given how great the Borei Angkor is, you absolutely should. Our half day expeditions into the temple areas (between naps) were affordably managed with cars provided by the hotel. The main restaurant is a beautifully built Khmer style wooden pavilion, open air and surrounded by a carp and lotus-filled moat. The breakfast was plentiful, though options for those unaccustomed to Asian breakfast items such as noodles and rice porridge might find the choices limited. Dinner at the hotel was very good, especially the western options. The menu would benefit from more Khmer selections, but all the meals were flavourful and well presented. I also liked the fish pond in the bathroom by the lodge and the plants in our room. Very fun. The staff were kind, but a bit overwhelmed since we came on a major holiday weekend and the place was full. The proprietors could have been more engaged or taken the time to welcome us since we stayed three nights and saw them around a bit. Other similar establishments I've been to around the world have had more friendly proprietors. Also, since the bridge has been out for 5 months, I think they could out up some signs on the alternate driving route. Overall a lovely visit. I would visit again if it wasn't such a long drive to get there. Show more Katherine , United States Sakal Guesthouse 7.4 Very good Based on 321 reviews Enjoyable stay,the hotel is in a very good location to all bars and restaurants and the beach!food In the hotel is nice and cheap,the rooms are reasonably clean but are very comfortable with a good range of tv channels in British for when u are chilling out,the shower is hit and miss if there is hot water but we asked the staff and they made sure we got hot water. staff are friendly and will answer any questions you need.good amenities around the hotel such as travel agents,restaurants bars(for sports if u need) a cinemas with all the latest releases and you can hire private rooms and play on FIFA and watch films which is good fun if that's what you like especially when you have been travelling a while and miss some home comforts! Show more Sean , United Kingdom Patpat Guesthouse 8.2 Excellent Based on 55 reviews Hotel was new and hasn't been opened that long. Owners are an extended French family really lovely people who couldn't do enough for us. All rooms around the central pool at ground level. Some teething problems but minor. No tea and coffee making facilities either in or our of the room but the owner let me make tea behind the bar as we are very early risers. We would prefer one sheet over us instead of the two very light blankets provided. Breakfasts were good. No TV as cable not yet installed. Show more Janet , Australia VIBOLA Guesthouse 7.8 Very good Based on 127 reviews We booked three nights in Kampot at Vibola guesthouse. Sad to say, but this will likely be our last time using Agoda. The room smelled of mildew in both the bedroom and the bathroom. The bathroom had mildew everywhere. I believe the A/C needed service too because I woke up halfway through the night with allergy problems. Likely had mold in the A/C system. The reception was terrible - barely spoke English. It is impossible to relax at this hotel - the walls are thin and since the two small buildings face each other around the pool, you can hear everything - including the noisy staff at 5 am. The pool is cloudy. I would not dare swim in it. Left early. Spend a few more dollars and find somewhere nicer or just sleep on the street. EW. PS - Traveling for 3 months so far, around 15 - 20 places we have stayed in. This is by far the worst. Show more Benjamin , United States Mid City Hotel 8 Very good Based on 69 reviews The place is nice. It is 5-10 minute walk to the bar street and night market, but quiet enough to have good night sleep. The breakfast has a selection of 5-7 foods, but low on diary products and is average in taste. The pool is not big with max of 5-7 person that can lay around it. Rooms with pool view has an extra wooden bed to sunbath on a balcony. Try taking the higher floors as 2 floor with balconies overlooking the pool make you fell a bit unprotected, like the crowd at the pool is looking at you. And 2 floor on the other side of the hotel overlooks the opposite building, which is fine until it is being built inside, but would be strange as someone will start living there. Show more Darya , Ukraine RS Guesthouse 7.7 Very good Based on 176 reviews First of all you should understand that Phnom Penh is a very dirty and poverty stricken area. This hotel has 4 floors and no elevator, so be prepared to climb stairs. The rooms are very basic with no character. I stayed in three different rooms. All three had poor water pressure in the showers, and if you get a bathtub you will notice that there is no stopper/plug, so you cant actually fill the tub to take a bath. Staff was friendly and the place was clean. Show more heath , United States GBT 3 Guesthouse 6.4 Good Based on 32 reviews The Moon Villa 8 Very good Based on 576 reviews I've never been the type to be fussy about the type of hotel that i stay in but my stay here was just simply disappointing. We booked a triple room at the moon villa and cafe, thank god only for 1 night. We checked into our room and no doubt it was spacious but it was somewhat like an attic converted into a room. It was at the top floor/roof of the building and it was really hot. AC wasn't working by the time we got back at night and it was really stuffy. There was no staff at the reception area so we had to sweat the whole night. Wanted to make a reservation for Phare Circus after looking at the brochures provided at the hotel but the lady receptionist had no idea what it was and because she couldnt speak much english, we decided to head right over to the circus instead. Breakfast was simple but i guess it's fair enough for the price we paid. Staff helped us pack it in a box for our sunrise at Angkor Wat. Cheap but really not worth the poor night's sleep. Wouldn't come back again. Show more Zhi , Singapore Sok Heng Guesthouse 7.9 Very good Based on 27 reviews The Guesthouse is relatively new and tidy compare to other hostel in the island. Everything is nice but there is hot water Yan , Hong Kong Jasmine Lodge 7.5 Very good Based on 170 reviews the room i stayed in was extremely clean and very large. the roof top restaurant/lounge was very nice and perfect for relaxing in after a long day at the temples. the tuk tuk driver was awesome and very friendly; he was very eager to take me places and help me out with anything along the way. he was never pushy at all about going places or about fares. there is wifi but i was mostly unable to access it in my room. it worked fine in the roof top restaurant. the staff was very friendly and accommodating. overall, it was a great stay and i would definitely stay there again. Show more Kristin , United States KIM Guest House 8.6 Excellent Based on 124 reviews My boyfriend and I stayed at KIM for three nights and really enjoyed it. There is parking in front of the guesthouse and it is very secure as the gate gets closed at night and there is always someone at the desk. The staff were helpful and the owner was very friendly, nice to talk to. The location is in a more local area but it is not too far of a walk down to the riverside. The guesthouse provides laundry service but with very expensive prices so we got our laundry done at a place a couple streets over for a good price. Overall I don't think you can beat the value for money in Phnom Penh and we would definitely stay here again. Show more Tina , Canada Boutique Dormitory Kochi-ke 8.4 Excellent Based on 174 reviews For a steal, you get a relatively private capsule/bed in this clean, quiet hostel. Can't beat the location, it's seconds away from everything (old market, night market, pub street). They have very cheap tours as well. Bed itself is a bit uncomfortable. The center of the mattress was sunken in. But they provide a clean pillow, blanket, and towel. Capsule/bunk has outlet, light, and mini shelf. Shared shower. Female-only room with lockers (you need your own lock). Overall, quiet guests. Great for a short stay and as a launching point for exploring Siem Reap! Show more Tiffany , United States Angkor Ry Boutique 8.6 Excellent Based on 107 reviews Angkor Ry was a little home to us everyday after long hours of temple visiting. The staffs were extremely friendly and had helped us with our laundry, tuk tuk booking and minivan booking. They always greeted us with a big smile even at 4am when we were leaving for sunrise at Angkor Wat. The minivan driver we hired, Dara, was fantastic too! Dara performed beyond as a driver by giving so much information about places we went and he also brought us to some cheap eateries for locals, which we had been searching for! And about the hotel, it's well-decorated, well-equipped, new, spotless, the bed was the best we had slept on in our SEA trip, and the rooms we got were just huge. With this affordable price tag, Angkor Ry is undoubtedly the best accom we could find in Siem Reap and I will definitely recommend everyone I know to stay here. Show more Jeyee , Malaysia eOCambo Village 9.1 Exceptional Based on 43 reviews Staff were extremely cordial and helpful. I had made a detailed itinerary to travel to North and East Cambodia besides covering the Angkor complex. Staff had supported me in getting vehicle appropriately arranged. I would like to thanks Mr. Sith for driving me on all the days. Also, would like to place on record, my thanks to Ms Nita from the front desk for being extremely kind and helpful throughout my stay. In all a fantastic place to stay. Show more Gre , Hong Kong The Artist Guesthouse 8.4 Excellent Based on 199 reviews Artist Guesthouse is a boutique hotel near the National Museum. They have good sized rooms that are very clean and white, and good Western food on the main floor. The staff was very helpful and speak English well for Cambodia. They function as workers for the restaurant and the diner below. The rooms are very clean with the usual amenities in a 3 star. My bathroom was separate from my shower which was unique. The air con works great and they have stylish interiors with french posters and unique coffee cups and other small touches. The food downstairs is good but maybe a bit pricey. The service is very good friendly and helpful. Everyone is nice and helpful and you are close to the Museum and the art district just far enough away from the noise of riverside. I enjoyed it and it's a nice mellow place literally 300 meters from the National Museum which is indeed a treasure (it's open aired so be prepared to be hot) Show more Jerome , United States Rainbow Lodge Tatai 8.5 Excellent Based on 12 reviews Golden Mango Inn 8.6 Excellent Based on 436 reviews We are beyond pleased. Super, mega, highly-recommended for those who are looking for great service, good location at super affordable prices. We would like to commend hotel manager PAGNA and the entire staff for making our stay very comfortable. A week prior to our stay, I emailed them directly to ask about free airport shuttle and arranged tours, and Pagna emailed back quickly, no downtime! When he was not around, another staff answered the email on his behalf. I knew then that we are going to be in good hands. Our flight was delayed an hour and tuktuk driver patiently waited for us, even if it was closed to midnite already. We got to the hotel and eveything is ready: room, internet access, arranged tour the ff morning. And there's unlimited coffee, chocolate drink, and tea...internet access is fast! Assigned English tour guide Lynet was great! On our 2nd day, we were gladly accommodated for a late check out without addt'l charges - way too cool. Siem Reap is so far the best couple day away we had. The experience, the people -- two thumbs up! Show more Jennifer , Philippines Okay Guesthouse 6.9 Good Based on 358 reviews It was tolerable after I upgraded from the economy room I booked. The room I booked was so small I could not unpack my backpack and no window except into the hall way. My biggest problem was the internet which I need while traveling. First of all it was extremely slow--I could only be on briefly and then it would flip to "no internet access" and it may take an hour before I could actually get back on. I needed to up load something to the net so I put it on a thumb drive and tried to use one of their downstairs computer,,,which are not free to use. I don't mind paying but their machine could not read my drive and later when I placed my thumb drive back into my computer I picked up a bad virus. I almost lost my computer but thankfully Norton was able to recover it for me. Because of the internet or actually lack of it I would not stay there again. However, the staff was very nice,,food good and location centrally located. If you don't need internet it would be a good place to stay...Also, if you need a tuk tuk driver a man named Hun is usually parked in front and he is excellent. Show more Jon , United States Good Morning Guesthouse 7.7 Very good Based on 177 reviews Room like a small prison cell, stains on walls, bed sheets and pillow dirty and smelly with hair, door broken didn't feel secure. One of the worse guesthouses we've stayed at despite having low expectations as we've travelled all around South East Asia and Cambodia itself on a small budget. Staff not particularly friendly nor unfriendly but not very helpful. However, there was hot water and that's pretty rare in itself. Location was not bad. Found a much better place the next morning and moved. Show more Christine , United Kingdom Mealy Chenda Guesthouse 6.5 Good Based on 67 reviews the hotel is right in the middle of small(compared to pattaya) area for night pleasure, hostess bars and restaurants. i wish i was at least 10 years younger. room is spacious and fairly clean as usual and tv was broken as usual too. the owner lady was nice and helpful and employees were ok except for their restaurant. i didn't get what i ordered after waiting for almost 1 hour. there are many restaurants in front of the hotel. i recommend anyone to go to one of them. the hotel is kind of far from popular beaches. there are better hotels at same prices in the walking distance from any beach. Show more masuji , Japan Alibi Guesthouse 8.3 Excellent Based on 334 reviews I loved staying in Alibi. Its centered location allowed me to explore Phnom Penh easily on foot, on my own, feeling safe and secure returning to the hotel even after dark. The French owner was helpful, the Cambodian girls (especially Poulin, one of the receptionist girls) is the most attentive and kind. The room is small but well equipped, have tv, AC, fan, internet, private bathroom, nice beddings and comfortable beds. I particularly loved the pretty patio, where they serve delicious Cambodian coffee and French baguette. The Khmer music played creates an atmosphere you just want to spend more time in. Great times in Alibi, I wold surely return and recommend it to anyone visiting Phnom Penh. Show more Preston , United States The Bright Lotus Guesthouse 8.3 Excellent Based on 50 reviews First, the location is walking distance to the Royal Palace, National Museum, Mekong Lake (Sisowath Quay), Central Market, restaurants and pub. (if walking is a problem, you can take Tuktuk and go around the place) Second, the room is spacious, clean (just need to change the toilet rug), and not being fussy, the room is OK. Third, the receptionists (owners) and staffs are kind and helpful. Fourth, the guest house has their own restaurant on the ground floor. Fifth, they offer varieties of transportation and tour around Cambodia, even to Vietnam and Thailand. We had a good time. You can forgive them thanks to their friendliness, but hotel management needs to make a effort in training the staff. At this time, certainly value for money Also, be informed that no room cleaning on Sundays Show more JACQUES , Belgium Sokha Phnom Penh Residence 7.9 Very good Based on 41 reviews Staff are friendly n helpful, service are pretty good n helpful,room is big enough to cover my 5 member of family, included the kitchen accessories n best of stay. Will come back again.
